column4: got issues with a fat32 partition, need to mount it as RW for SAMBA access
check mount first to see if its mounted as rw
its a console command, which can be done by going through terminal
if you're going to paste, don't paste in here use pastebin
ok its mounted as read write, now read this: https://help.ubuntu.com/9.10/serverguide/C/samba-fileserver.html#samba-fileserver-configuration
i have tried to follow that
basically i have the folders shared, but i cant write to them via samba from either a windows machine or a ubuntu one
ok I need you to paste your smb.conf
you can use pastebinit to quickly paste stuff even from dmesg
seems like only printer is shared or the actual share for your FAT32 is not visible in that paste
